history.content:
DS 100 is more of a data science class than an ML class. While it does cover ML extremely briefly, it does not go very in depth with this as the focus of the course is not really ML. To answer your questions specifically:

1) CS 161 project 1 is fairly difficult in that you need to understand conceptually the topics from class covered in the project; not much actual coding, but knowledge of 61C is pretty much required. Project 2 is conceptually easier but much harder to actually implement as well as being vastly more time consuming (as an example, I spent ~10 hours total on project 1 but ~25-30 hours total on project 2). Project 3 at least when I took it Spring 2018 was extremely easy and straightforward (< 3 hours total) but this may change since it was an experimental project that semester.

2) Probably redundant to take DS 100 based on the classes you've taken and are planning to take. As mentioned before, it doesn't really go that in depth with ML stuff. Based on the info you provided in your post I'd say take 161 next semester.

children.subject: Definitely would recommend CS161 based on what you've taken. It was also just an awesome class - you learn a lot.

history.content:
I am debating between taking CS 161 and DS 100 next semester. Can someone who has taken any of these courses share their opinions on the following questions:

1. Are the projects of CS 161 very difficult?

2. Will it be redundant to take DS 100 if I've taken STAT 134, STAT 135, CS 186, CS 188 and will take CS 189 next semester? Is it a course that teaches using various Python ML packages?

Thx so much!
history.subject: CS 161 VS DS 100
